含义.解释: The character '了' is a versatile Chinese character that primarily functions as a grammatical particle. It is often used to indicate the completion of an action (similar to the past tense in English) or to express a change of state. It can also be used as a modal particle to soften the tone of a sentence or to indicate a new situation.

字形.描述: The character '了' is composed of two strokes. The first stroke is a horizontal line, and the second stroke is a vertical line with a hook at the bottom. Its simple structure makes it one of the most recognizable characters in Chinese.

字源.解释: The character '了' originally depicted a person bending over, symbolizing the completion of an action. Over time, its meaning evolved to focus more on its grammatical functions, such as indicating completion or change.

列表: 我吃完了。 (I have finished eating.)
Once, a student was struggling to understand a difficult concept. After much effort, he finally said, '我明白了！' (I understand now!). This moment of clarity brought him great joy and relief.
A traveler once got lost in a forest. After hours of wandering, he saw a light in the distance and exclaimed, '天亮了！' (The sky has brightened!). He followed the light and found his way home.
《静夜思》 - 李白: '床前明月光，疑是地上霜。举头望明月，低头思故乡。' (The bright moonlight in front of my bed, I suspect it's frost on the ground. I raise my head to gaze at the moon, then lower it, thinking of my hometown.)
《登鹳雀楼》 - 王之涣: '白日依山尽，黄河入海流。欲穷千里目，更上一层楼。' (The sun sets behind the mountains, the Yellow River flows into the sea. To extend the view a thousand miles, ascend yet one more floor.)
